clinical_study.brief_title: Ocular Manifestations of Inflammatory Bowel Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Ocular Manifestations of Chronic Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD): Retrospective Study in the Hepato-gastroenterology Department of the Nancy CHRU

brief_summary.textblock: Ocular damage is found in the 3rd rank of extra intestinal manifestations (MEI) Potentially serious functional complications (see uveitis and risk of blindness) requiring rapid management Rare uveitis in the literature (0.5% -3%), study on a large sample to assess their prevalence in patients with IBD at the Nancy CHRU and describe all the ocular manifestations that can be found.

primary_outcome.description: frequency of ocular manifestations in inflammatory bowel disease

secondary_outcome.description: Number of uveitis, scleritis and episcleritis; prevalence calculation

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with chronic inflammatory bowel disease who consulted in ophthalmology

intervention.description: search in medical files for reasons for ophthalmology consultation, functional signs, clinical signs, treatment, characteristics of IBD
intervention.arm_group_label: patients with chronic inflammatory bowel disease who consulted in ophthalmology

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients followed at Nancy University Hospital for IBD and having consulted in the ophthalmology department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients followed at Nancy University Hospital for IBD and having consulted in the ophthalmology department
Exclusion Criteria:
- Minor patients
- patients without IBD
- patients for whom there is no ophthalmology consultation
